caption: Great birthday dinner.
Always gracious and delicious.
Overall, I just need to congratulate the workforce, cooks and crew for a extremely good night. They even went the greater mile of giving a present for my date!
One factor to factor out though is that the musicians serenading for the night had been a bit bland but surely improvements can be done.

We love Riccardo Trattoria. Reminds us of a Trattoria in Italy! The food is always excellent accompanied by wonderful service (Christian and Francisco are the best)! Thanks for making every visit such a special experience.
Very authentic, high quality Italian cuisine at a friendly price 😁

(Translated by Google) Excellent Italian restaurant. Quite expensive, but in line with Downtown Chicago prices.  Loved the Milanese cutlet and the ravioli with shellfish.  (Original) Ottimo ristorante italiano. Abbastanza caro, ma in linea con i prezzi di Downtown Chicago.  È piaciuta molto la cotoletta alla milanese e i ravioli con i crostacei.
One of my fav spots for tasty italian food. I look forward to a return trip. The bill was reasonable I would say.

Wow. I don’t know where to begin. The service at Riccardo Trattoria is impeccable from valet to server/bartender. This hidden gem is a breath of fresh Italian air. The prosciutto e burrata was one of the best in the city. The stuffed Asiago gnocchi was a true representation of simple but quality ingredients at it’s finest. The bucatini carbonara was an incredibly done classic. The panna cotta rivaled that of Spacca Napoli. Christian was amazing, professional, polite, warm and inviting, and vastly knowledgeable of the menu. Tony was fantastic with true pronunciation of everything we ordered. Luis is the embodiment of everything that the restaurant industry is... HARDWORK! Highly recommend this gorgeous spot. Chin chin!

an extraordinary restaurant through and through. refined Italian classics with extraordinary flavor. just had carryout for the first time after numerous dine-in experiences in the past. the food was just as good because the details were not ignored.

Again, this is my favorite restaurant in Chicago. Amazing Italian food, service, warmth, drinks, ambiance. If you haven't visited Riccardo's, please go. And leave room for the ricotta cheesecake dessert. You are welcome! 😁
Great service, delicious food! Perfect place for a date. :D

Great wine list and intimate atmosphere. We came in wanting handmade pasta and probably didn’t order the right item. The pescatore pasta was good but pasta was not featured and dang I just wanted some good handmade pasta. The pizza was super good and fun to share.
Amazing food and service..will go back.
Love this place. Fresh cheese flown in from Italy. Great pastas. Homemafe deserts
Just excellent food. It is wonderful. What else can I say.

The ASIAGO CHEESE FILLED GNOCCHI TARTUFATI with butter parmesan sauce with burgundy truffle was amazing!! Enjoyed the POLPETTINE veal and ricotta meatballs, ossobuco & porcini sauce. Excellent EGGPLANT & ZUCCHINI PARMIGIANA AU GRATIN with tomato and basil The LAMB CHOP MILANESE breaded & pan fried top with arugula & grape tomato to me was just average and the low point of the meal. It tasted just like a regular schnitzel. To be honest I couldn’t differentiate that this was lamb I was eating. The CIOCCOLATISSIMO with vanilla gelato and amarene (10 minutes to bake) was the highlight of my meal besides the gnocchi! It was delicious! The TORTA DI MELE warm apple pie with vanilla gelato was good too. To end the meal we had some sambucca and lemoncello shots which hit the spot. The coffee was delicious also! It was a very small and cozy Italian atmosphere at Riccardo Trattoria! Definitely enjoyed the food and experience. Came here for restaurant week. Very small beer menu list..
Best Tuscan food we have eaten in a long time  .can go  up against any mid-range Florentine restaurant
Best food and service ever

Impeccable service, attentive without being intrusive, great recommendations of both wine and food. All the apps and entrees were fantastic! Lamb and veal were cooked to perfection along with a delicious halibut dish and pasta! Great spot for date night or just a nice dinner out. Will be returning!
(Translated by Google) Grest  (Original) Grest

What a fabulous find! Impeccable service, delicious food, great atmosphere. The servers seamlessly run the dining room, overlapping for very attentive service. We never felt rushed and the dining experience was tailored to our pace. What a wonderful blend of patrons. Families and couples and friends. Antipasti choices were abundant with perfect portions. The variety of salads were also great and fresh ripe heirloom tomatoes in December was mouthwatering. Bolognese was tangy and flavorful as was the crab and lobster ravioli with lemon cream sauce. Will definitely return and will definitely recommend!
Very crowded and tight quarters.

Amazing food ! Everything I had this evening is fresh and delicious . Brenda our server  and the whole team in general killed it today . Service is fast . Brenda doesn’t make anyone wait . My first time here but for sure not the last .
Great Italian classics, wonderful pastas. Wine list shorter than the menu though and the room could benefit from some softer lights and music.  Still, not hard to see why regulars keep coming back.
Loved the food quality and taste! It also has competitive prices.
Really good pasta. Very large menu with lots of selection
Lovely food. Indifferent service.
The service, the staff, and the food are excellent!

Good food but the server was very eager to turn over our table after a 2 hour visit. I was catching up with a friend I hadn't seen in 3 years and despite the mention here that people spend 1.5-2.5 hours here, I found the time after 1.5 hours to be pretty stressful, especially after they quit filling my water glass at that point. You may wish to start looking at your watch after an hour to avoid a similar fate and not inconvenience the servers and other diners, or look at another restaurant.
Amazing entrees and great service. You cant go wrong here.
Food is superb, but the staff rushes people in a way unsuitable to an Italian restaurant.
Extensive menu, Great Service.  Beat grilled  calamari and quail special entree.
Always amazing and authentic Italian dishes.  It makes you feel like you are visiting Italy at least for a brief moment.

Riccardo Trattoria is a local cozy Italian Restaurant in Lincoln Park with amazing Italian cuisine.  Such a quaint place that makes you feel like you are in Italy.  The wine was delicious as well.  It's our go to for sure.  We love love and recommend Riccardo Trattoria.  Bellissima! Buon Appetito
(Translated by Google) Spectacular, we celebrated his friend's birthday.  (Original) espectacular, celebramos él cumpleaños de un amigo.

Absolutely amazing pizza! Great customer care with J.P and will definitely return and recommend to others. And HOLY cow... I have Celiac and have had many gluten free pizzas in my time, this place has had THE best one I’ve ever have and largest by far! Thanks J.P for extraordinary customer service and pizza, keep up the great work!
Fantastic experience! Food, ambiance was terrific!

Great food & meal..... Owner yells at us for using the other Ricardo gift certificate.... While they shuffle food & products across the street between each restaurant!.... Go yell at more customers for BS reasons!!!..... Won't be back!!!
Food was great. Tables are tight and remind me of Europe where table sizes are small and close together. Service was average.
Soooooo  delicious and friendly
Great food with a vast selection. They handled my 12 top with ease.
Great spot for authentic Italian! Great food, great service!
Great food and service, new favorite spot for us.

There are no places like Riccardo Trattoria. I'm Italian ( moved here in my 30s) and fore Riccardo Trattoria is home. The risottos are to die for. The best spot for real Italian dining and charm. Love love love
It was a wonderful experience. The staff always courteous and professional.  The food is absolutely delicious.
Most authentic Italian in Chicago - has food and atmosphere of restaurants in Rome and Milan.
Best Italian restaurant in Chicago 💝💝

I was so tickled to find this place, late as I am to the party! A proper & bustling, tiny trattoria...with beautiful food and top-notch, no-nonsense service. Wonderfully toothy, house-made pastas, perfectly prepared & sauced. Delicately simple, spot-on fish preparations. A wide variety of authentic starters & salads. All generously portioned. I went with a larger group, so we tasted a lot of the menu. No failures to be found there. I had an old favorite of mine, the orecchiette w/ rapini & sausage, & it's haunted me since (in the best way)...always a sign of mine of the very best joints. And, if all this isn't enough, they'll cheerfully go off-menu for you. They've also got a wine bar across the street, w/ many shared menu items, that's available for Postmates delivery. So, I'll be hoppin' online, pronto!
A coworker and I go here whenever in town. Amazing service and food. Grab a drink across the street at their sister restaurant and pizzeria while you wait for your reservation time.

Amazing food in a friendly atmosphere!! We went for restaurant week and they had an extensive menu of homeade pastas, meats and seafood to choose from. Our waiter was courteous and helpful in providing suggestions. By far the best Italian food I have had in the city in a long time!
Nice wait staff and good food
If you want italian food this is the place,
Delicious Italian food, nice wine list, attentive service.
Great!
Best Authentic northern Italian restaurant in Chicago. Amazing food.

Ricardo Trattoria is probably the best Italian restaurant in Chicago. A truly authentic Tuscan restaurant which would not be out of place if you came across it in Firenze or Sienna. Great food, great atmosphere
Great service and nice cozy place. Authentic fresh Italian pasta.
Honest. Food was great, but does not compare to Italy.

Cozy, atmosphere,  great service, The cornish hen in lemon sauce was AMAZING,  I tasted the lobster ravioli and that was SUPER DELICIOUS! The wine list was pricey but the 2015 Barbera wine was very good!
A tired old neighborhood restaurant that has its devotees but sincerely cannot compete with newer Italian restaurants in Chicago. Try Monteverde instead.
Fantastic
Good not great - lower expectations
oso busco tremendous. great atmosphere. great wine
Everything about this place is awesome. HIGHLY Recommend!
Great atmosphere, great food!
(Translated by Google) Super deli, super recommendable  (Original) Super deli, super recomendable
Good atmosphere, great food!
We've been coming here for about 5 years. I've tried most of the other high rated Michelin Italian restaurants. This place still remains a personal favorite
Amazing fresh pasta and delicious dessert!!!

We went on a Sunday night. It is a CLASSIC italian place that is well worth your time. Bread brought out HOT with good butter. Best cioppino I have had. Also the gnocchi was terrific. Don't skip it if you have a chance
My family and I absolutely love this place. The food is amazing and the service is great. The lobster linguini and lasagna are the best!
Excellent
Delicious... great southern italian food in a simple but very comfortable location. Must try!
One of the best Italian restaurants in Chicago
Authentic italian place. Feels comfortable and familiar. Families welcome. Solid set menu and creative specials daily. Not a deep liqour selection. The wine list is mostly Italian and decent.
Good food, good service and a nice atmosphere
GO there all the time
Try their grill octopus. They are so good.
Such incredible food
Come to Chicago 1 time a year & always eat here.  Food is outstanding!  Closest to being in Italy for Itialian food.
Wonderful food and cozy atmosphere

Brought my wife here for Valentine's Day and had one of the most amazing experiences. The food was excellent and the staff was extremely friendly and attentive. I will definitely go back and recommend it to my friends and family!
We had three very different dishes but all were spectacular. Gnocchi with ox tail, lasagna, pasta with wild boar sausage. Fantastic!!
Fantastic food, intimate seating. Their restaurant week menu was perfect.
Though this old standby gets good reviews, I think there are many better Italian restaurants in the city. The decor is also old and tired. Others in our party thought the food was very good.
Amazing food and great service!  We came in on a busy night without a reservation  and they still  fit us in right away
Best risotto and tiramisu I've ever had
Very small dining area
Great Service and Food!!! I highly recommend this restaurant and the lobster ravioli.
Highly recommended if you like Italian. Chitarra alla carbonara was authentic, and part of the team is Italian. Reservation necessary.
Authentic Italian

We dined there 1 week ago and had a soft shell crab hors appetizer that was excellent but the seafood linguini was to die for,the best I have ever eaten. The service was superb! Any visit to this wonderful city is incomplete without a visit to this superb  restaurant.
(Translated by Google) Very delicious food and excellent service from the waiters, I recommend this place  (Original) Muy deliciosa comida y excelente servicio de los meseros,le recomiendo este lugar

Excellent neighborhood Italian restaurant for an enjoyable evening meal out or for a special occasion. Friendly, menu-knowledgeable, and attentive waitstaff. I recommend the duck with the aranciata rossa (blood orange) sauce.
Delicious Italian food.  Stop in and try it out!

My boyfriend and I dined here for "pre-Valentines Day". This place closed at 10, we arrived a little before 9:30, which is their last seating for the night. and we weren't greeted for about 5 minutes although a certain employee noticed us standing there a couple of times. After we were seated, we noticed that same certain employee and our own server whispering amongst each other and staring at us multiple times. I felt very uncomfortable eating and spending here and wanted to leave as quickly as possible . Also, the pasta was too firm for my own liking.
Fantastic Italian food. Excellent desserts and wine.
Great food but noisy.

FABULOUS Cozy. Wait staff real pros, and charming. Food very special. Squash blossoms filled with smoked prosciutto and moz simply devine. Shave white truffles over house-made pasta . . . well we could smell the dish from 10 feet away and it delivered on it's promise! Yummy holiday cake with house-made brandy marscapone with fruits. Well priced selections of wine including some very nice Italian ones by the glass. A must stop!
Great place for an anniversary dinner!
Great food, fantastic environment. Veal parm is heavenly.
The food SUCKED will NEVER go back! What place has no chicken? The pasta was hard the bread was just plain it surw isn't THE BEST IN CHICAGO!
The food was horrible
Quality Italian dining with great service. Besides the food, the dessert is delicious!
Great food! Love the pasta
Authentic Italian experience and food. Best Italian food in Chicago.

Delightfully intimate setting with an old-school Italian feel.  I was not expecting it to be as small as it was, but it was perfect for a date.  Jam packed for a Monday night, it wasn't so close packed as to make it difficult to converse or to be overheard.  The food was delicious and the presentation immaculate.  I will definitely be returning here!
Fantastic restaurant with perfect atmosphere. Their mushroom salad is a must try.

Super cute and cozy spot in a very neighborhoody area of Lincoln Park.  Food was delicious, and service was warm and accomodating.  We sat at a table near the hallway leading to the kitchen and bathrooms, and there was such a nice rapport among the staff--no doubt the food is prepared with Amore!  If you love Italian, this is not-to-be-missed.

Real Italian food!!!  If you pass through on the street you cannot imagine how amazing is the past in this place.  The chef works for hobby, it's a small place with fresh pasta and REALLY delicious sauce.  RESERVATION is really recommended.

I moved to old town about a year ago.  I have walked to this place several times with various people.  I am some one who will order the same food at a place all the time.  I have never ordered the same meal twice here and have always had extremely delicious food.  The service has been amazing and they usually remember me.  They have asked me a few times how my mom is becasue she came with me once.

My first dinner at Trattoria Riccardo was excellent! I had a delicious dish of Pappardalle with Porcini mushrooms, it was amazing. Our server, a very sweet Italian guy named Luca, recommended a great wine to go with our dinner, and really made it a relaxing, enjoyable experience. I would recommend this place to anyone for a great date night, or a night out with the girls!

This is supposed to be the best in Chicago?  I do not agree.  THere are definitely others, how about Pelago or Merlo or Coco Pazzo or Spiaggia?  This is a good neighborhood place, if it is in your neighborhood and you have a reservation.  Nothing terrible here but, really?  The reviews are over the top compared to what it is and I have been there several times.
Snobby service. Very bipolar restaurant. Some of the dishes were excellent and some were really bad.

An actual Italian restaurant. Not just Italian style. Even though it was a Monday and Riccardo was off (he has off Monday and Tuesday), the place was near capacity. It's not very big. So, if you are more than 3, I'd suggest making a reservation. Everyone was chatting but it wasn't too loud which made conversation easy. Great place for a date. I was dressed business casual and felt a little under dressed. Oh, and the food was really good. The portion wasn't huge but was just enough to leave a little room for dessert. I had the Veal & Ricotta Meatloaf "Cesarina" and Cioccolatissimo.

Nice old fashioned Italian. We were told they gave our table away to the owners lawyer. I was surprised at the honesty. However, after a little shuffling around we were quickly accommodated. Nice wait staff, good food, tight room.  I will definitely go back.
Several notches above the typical Chicago Italian restaurant. Outstanding service and great ingredients. Can be tough to get a table.
